p: In addition, HIV-1 infection and the progression to full-blown AIDS is recognized to cause a depletion in CD4+ T-cells [ 75]. Activated CD4+ T-cells release IL-2, a key cytokine for CD4+ and CD8+ T-cell proliferation, differentiation, and viability [ 76, 77]. Compromised IL-2 levels prevent activation of other downstream effector cell sub-types, including CTLs, and progressive decline in CD4+ T-cell levels. Low CD4+ T-cell counts lead to increased risk for opportunistic infections, and M. tb is often one of the first severe opportunistic infections acquired [ 78]. Collectively, a shift to the Th2 subtype and decline in CD4+ T-cells overall produces an impaired ability to clear the M. tb infection, which is why HIV is the most significant risk factor for M. tb [ 79].
